integration build 0423

- start in the Resource perspective
- File -> New -> Project
- Plug-in Development -> Plug-in Project, Next
- set Project Name = asdf, Next, Next
- click Create a new plug-in using... radio
- select Hello World, Next, Finish
- close the auto-opened plugin.xml editor
- expand the new project in the Navigator, including the contained src/asdf tree
- hold CTRL and select in this order: asdfPlugin.java and .classpath
- right-click -> Open
- get the attached SWT error

For some reason I can't view my attachment.  Its contents are pasted below, 
just in case I'm not the only one with this problem:

Not able to repeat on XP

I've been investigating this problem since I think it's the cause of a GP 
that's assigned to me.  What I've found, using build 0510 (sorry if it gets 
long <g>):

- When performing the steps to reproduce the problem on WIN32 the editors are 
always opened in the order of .classpath followed by asdfPlugin.java, 
regardless of selection order.  The .java editor becomes the "current" editor.
- When doing the same steps on motif the editors always open in the opposite 
order, which isn't the problem.  But then the .java editor is made 
the "current" editor, even though it was opened first.  This is where the 
NPE/GP occurs.

I think that the reconciler gets activated when the java editor is first 
opened, then later causes the workbench to move the editor focus from 
the .classpath editor back to the .java editor before it's ready to do so.  Put 
a breakpoint in the run() block in CompilationUnitEditor.reconciled() and trace 
forward to see this.  I'm able to make this problem go away by turning on 
the "Synchronize outline selection on cursor move" checkbox on the Java -> Work 
in Progress preference page.

JDT can you verify that this is a reconciler problem?

20020423-I on linux-motif and
20020521-I on linux-motif:

  got a segmentation violation.

works fine with 20020521-I on linux-gtk.

with 20020528-I linux-motif, I didn't get a segmentation violoation,
but an 'ordinary' exit of the JVM with 'Operation not permitted'.

steps: need to add org.eclipse.core.resources[.*]
Managed to reproduce it when the files are opened again after a restart.

I have the following results (with descending frequency of occurrence):

   1) Log entry for reentring WorkbenchPage.ActionSwitcher
   2) Widget disposed SWT exception
   3) VM crash
   4) VM exit with some error (once)
   5) Some other exception (once)

1) Involves a XtManagedChild on the menu item. To provoke this one, set a
breakpoint in WorkbenchActionSwitcher.updateActivePart() where the log is 
called.

2) seems impossible: The widget is flagged as disposed, right after its 
creation. The only explanation is a bug in SWT or X/Motif, which would mess up 
memory. After the menu item is created, most of the field values (including the 
handle) are zero-ed out thus throwing an SWTexception. This must have happened 
in the constructor of MenuItem). To provoke 2), set a breakpoint on 
SWTException.

3) crashes inside XtManageChildren(), see attached java core file.

4) and 5) only happened once.

Created an attachment (id=1099)
javacore for VM crash

Grant, I don't think it's a reconciler problem. Since in one case the VM 
crashed (3), and in the other case the widget was disposed although it's not 
possible by legal java code, I assume that it's a bug in SWT or X/Motif.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 14463 ***
